definition[0]: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events
example[0]: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
definition[1]: to make something by using whatever you can find because you do not have the equipment or materials that you need
example[1]: There were no nappies, so we had to improvise with what we could find.
example[2]: Annie improvised a sandpit for the children.
definition[2]: to invent music, words, a statement etc from your imagination, rather than planning or preparing it first
example[3]: I just started playing, and the other guys started improvising around me.
